013package org.apache.juneau.common.internal;
014
015import java.io.*;
016import java.nio.charset.*;
017import java.nio.file.*;
018import java.util.*;
019import java.util.concurrent.atomic.*;
020import java.util.function.*;
021
022/**
023 * Various I/O related utility methods.
024 */
025public class IOUtils {
026
027   /**
028    * Constructor.
029    */
030   protected IOUtils() {}
031
032   /** UTF-8 charset */
033   public static final Charset UTF8 = StandardCharsets.UTF_8;
034
035   /** Reusable empty input stream. */
036   public static final InputStream EMPTY_INPUT_STREAM = new InputStream() {
037      @Override
038      public int read() {
039         return -1;  // end of stream
040      }
041   };
042
043   private static final int BUFF_SIZE = 1024;
044   private static final ThreadLocal<byte[]> BYTE_BUFFER_CACHE = (Boolean.getBoolean("juneau.disableIoBufferReuse") ? null : new ThreadLocal<>());  // NOSONAR
045   private static final ThreadLocal<char[]> CHAR_BUFFER_CACHE = (Boolean.getBoolean("juneau.disableIoBufferReuse") ? null : new ThreadLocal<>());  // NOSONAR
046
047   static final AtomicInteger BYTE_BUFFER_CACHE_HITS = new AtomicInteger();
048   static final AtomicInteger BYTE_BUFFER_CACHE_MISSES = new AtomicInteger();
049   static final AtomicInteger CHAR_BUFFER_CACHE_HITS = new AtomicInteger();
050   static final AtomicInteger CHAR_BUFFER_CACHE_MISSES = new AtomicInteger();
051
052   static {
053      SystemUtils.shutdownMessage(()->"Byte buffer cache:  hits="+BYTE_BUFFER_CACHE_HITS.get()+", misses=" + BYTE_BUFFER_CACHE_MISSES);
054      SystemUtils.shutdownMessage(()->"Char buffer cache:  hits="+CHAR_BUFFER_CACHE_HITS.get()+", misses=" + CHAR_BUFFER_CACHE_MISSES);
055   }
056
057   /** Reusable empty reader. */
058   public static final Reader EMPTY_READER = new Reader() {
059      @Override
060      public int read() {
061         return -1;  // end of stream
062      }
063      @Override
064      public int read(char[] cbuf, int off, int len) throws IOException {
065         return -1;  // end of stream
066      }
067      @Override
068      public void close() throws IOException { /* no-op */ }
069   };
070
071   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
072   // Piping utilities.
073   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
074
075   /**
076    * Pipes the contents of the specified <c>Reader</c> to the specified file.
077    *
078    * @param in
079    *    The reader to pipe from.
080    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
081    *    <br>Reader is automatically closed.
082    * @param out
083    *    The file to write the output to.
084    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
085    * @return
086    *    The number of characters piped.
087    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
088    */
089   public static long pipe(Reader in, File out) throws IOException {
090      if (out == null || in == null)
091         return 0;
092      try (var w = FileWriterBuilder.create(out).buffered().build()) {
093         return pipe(in, w);
094      }
095   }
096
097   /**
098    * Pipes the contents of the specified <c>Reader</c> to the specified <c>Writer</c>.
099    *
100    * @param in
101    *    The reader to pipe from.
102    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
103    *    <br>Reader is automatically closed.
104    * @param out
105    *    The file to write the output to.
106    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
107    *    <br>Writer is flushed but not automatically closed.
108    * @return
109    *    The number of characters piped.
110    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
111    */
112   public static long pipe(Reader in, Writer out) throws IOException {
113      if (out == null || in == null)
114         return 0;
115      var total = 0l;
116      try (var in2 = in) {
117         var buffer = charBuffer(-1);
118         int readLen;
119         while ((readLen = in.read(buffer)) != -1) {
120            out.write(buffer, 0, readLen);
121            total += readLen;
122         }
123      }
124      out.flush();
125      return total;
126   }
127
128   /**
129    * Pipes the contents of the specified <c>Reader</c> to the specified <c>Writer</c>.
130    *
131    * @param in
132    *    The reader to pipe from.
133    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
134    *    <br>Reader is automatically closed.
135    * @param out
136    *    The file to write the output to.
137    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
138    *    <br>Writer is flushed but not automatically closed.
139    * @param onException Consumer of any {@link IOException I/O exceptions}.
140    * @return
141    *    The number of characters piped.
142    */
143   public static long pipe(Reader in, Writer out, Consumer<IOException> onException) {
144      try {
145         return pipe(in, out);
146      } catch (IOException e) {
147         onException.accept(e);
148         return -1;
149      }
150   }
151
152   /**
153    * Pipes the contents of the specified <c>Reader</c> to the specified <c>Writer</c> a line at a time.
154    *
155    * <p>
156    * Writer is flushed after every line.  Typically useful when writing to consoles.
157    *
158    * @param in
159    *    The reader to pipe from.
160    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
161    *    <br>Reader is automatically closed.
162    * @param out
163    *    The file to write the output to.
164    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
165    *    <br>Writer is flushed but not automatically closed.
166    * @return
167    *    The number of characters piped.
168    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
169    */
170   public static long pipeLines(Reader in, Writer out) throws IOException {
171      if (in == null || out == null)
172         return 0;
173      var total = 0l;
174      try (var in2 = in) {
175         try (var s = new Scanner(in2)) {
176            while (s.hasNextLine()) {
177               var l = s.nextLine();
178               if (l != null) {
179                  out.write(l);
180                  out.write("\n");
181                  out.flush();
182                  total += l.length() + 1;
183               }
184            }
185         }
186      }
187      return total;
188   }
189
190   /**
191    * Pipes the contents of the specified input stream to the writer.
192    *
193    * @param in
194    *    The stream to pipe from.
195    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
196    *    <br>Streams is automatically closed.
197    * @param out
198    *    The writer to pipe to.
199    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
200    *    <br>Stream is not automatically closed.
201    * @return
202    *    The number of bytes written.
203    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
204    */
205   public static long pipe(InputStream in, Writer out) throws IOException {
206      if (in == null || out == null)
207         return 0;
208      return pipe(new InputStreamReader(in, UTF8), out);
209   }
210
211   /**
212    * Pipes the contents of the specified input stream to the writer.
213    *
214    * @param in
215    *    The stream to pipe from.
216    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
217    *    <br>Streams is automatically closed.
218    * @param out
219    *    The writer to pipe to.
220    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
221    *    <br>Stream is not automatically closed.
222    * @param onException Consumer of any {@link IOException I/O exceptions}.
223    * @return
224    *    The number of bytes written.
225    */
226   public static long pipe(InputStream in, Writer out, Consumer<IOException> onException) {
227      try {
228         if (in == null || out == null)
229            return 0;
230         return pipe(new InputStreamReader(in, UTF8), out);
231      } catch (IOException e) {
232         onException.accept(e);
233         return -2;
234      }
235   }
236
237   /**
238    * Pipes the specified input stream to the specified output stream.
239    *
240    * <p>
241    * Either stream is not automatically closed.
242    *
243    * @param in
244    *    The input stream.
245    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
246    *    <br>Stream is automatically closed.
247    * @param out
248    *    The output stream.
249    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
250    *    <br>Stream is not automatically closed.
251    * @return The number of bytes written.
252    * @throws IOException If thrown from either stream.
253    */
254   public static long pipe(InputStream in, OutputStream out) throws IOException {
255      try (var in2 = in) {
256         return pipe(in, out, -1);
257      }
258   }
259
260   /**
261    * Pipes the specified input stream to the specified output stream.
262    *
263    * <p>
264    * Either stream is not automatically closed.
265    *
266    * @param in
267    *    The input stream.
268    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
269    *    <br>Stream is automatically closed.
270    * @param out
271    *    The output stream.
272    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
273    *    <br>Stream is not automatically closed.
274    * @param onException Consumer of any {@link IOException I/O exceptions}.
275    * @return The number of bytes written.
276    */
277   public static long pipe(InputStream in, OutputStream out, Consumer<IOException> onException) {
278      try {
279         try (var in2 = in) {
280            return pipe(in, out, -1);
281         }
282      } catch (IOException e) {
283         onException.accept(e);
284         return -1;
285      }
286   }
287
288   /**
289    * Pipes the specified input stream to the specified output stream.
290    *
291    * <p>
292    * Either stream is not automatically closed.
293    *
294    * @param in
295    *    The input stream.
296    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
297    *    <br>Stream is not automatically closed.
298    * @param out
299    *    The output stream.
300    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
301    *    <br>Stream is not automatically closed.
302    * @param maxBytes
303    *    The maximum number of bytes or <c>-1</c> to read the entire input stream.
304    * @return The number of bytes written.
305    * @throws IOException If thrown from either stream.
306    */
307   public static long pipe(InputStream in, OutputStream out, long maxBytes) throws IOException {
308      if (in == null || out == null)
309         return 0;
310      var buffer = byteBuffer((int)maxBytes);
311      int readLen;
312      var total = 0l;
313      if (maxBytes < 0) {
314         while ((readLen = in.read(buffer)) != -1) {
315            out.write(buffer, 0, readLen);
316            total += readLen;
317         }
318      } else {
319         var remaining = maxBytes;
320         while (remaining > 0) {
321            readLen = in.read(buffer, 0, buffSize(remaining));
322            if (readLen == -1)
323               break;
324            out.write(buffer, 0, readLen);
325            total += readLen;
326            remaining -= readLen;
327         }
328      }
329      out.flush();
330      return total;
331   }
332
333   /**
334    * Pipes the specified reader to the specified output stream.
335    *
336    * @param in
337    *    The input reader.
338    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
339    *    <br>Stream is automatically closed.
340    * @param out
341    *    The output stream.
342    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
343    *    <br>Stream is not automatically closed.
344    * @return The number of bytes written.
345    * @throws IOException If thrown from output stream.
346    */
347   public static long pipe(Reader in, OutputStream out) throws IOException {
348      if (in == null || out == null)
349         return 0;
350      var total = 0l;
351      try (var in2 = in) {
352         var osw = new OutputStreamWriter(out, UTF8);
353         var i = 0;
354         var b = charBuffer(-1);
355         while ((i = in.read(b)) > 0) {
356            total += i;
357            osw.write(b, 0, i);
358         }
359         osw.flush();
360      }
361      return total;
362   }
363
364   /**
365    * Pipes the specified reader to the specified output stream.
366    *
367    * @param in
368    *    The input reader.
369    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
370    *    <br>Stream is automatically closed.
371    * @param out
372    *    The output stream.
373    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
374    *    <br>Stream is not automatically closed.
375    * @param onException Consumer of any {@link IOException I/O exceptions}.
376    * @return The number of bytes written.
377    */
378   public static long pipe(Reader in, OutputStream out, Consumer<IOException> onException) {
379      try {
380         return pipe(in, out);
381      } catch (IOException e) {
382         onException.accept(e);
383         return -1;
384      }
385   }
386
387   /**
388    * Pipes the specified byte array to the specified output stream.
389    *
390    * @param in
391    *    The input byte array.
392    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
393    * @param out
394    *    The output stream.
395    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
396    *    <br>Stream is not automatically closed.
397    * @param maxBytes
398    *    The maximum number of bytes or <c>-1</c> to read the entire byte array.
399    * @return The number of bytes written.
400    * @throws IOException If thrown from output stream.
401    */
402   public static long pipe(byte[] in, OutputStream out, int maxBytes) throws IOException {
403      if (in == null || out == null)
404         return 0;
405      var length = (maxBytes < 0 || maxBytes > in.length ) ? in.length : maxBytes;
406      out.write(in, 0, length);
407      return length;
408   }
409
410   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
411   // Reading utilities.
412   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
413
414   /**
415    * Pipes the specified object to the specified output stream.
416    *
417    * @param in
418    *    The input byte array.
419    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> or any of the following types:
420    *    <ul>
421    *       <li>{@link Reader}
422    *       <li>{@link InputStream}
423    *       <li>{@link File}
424    *       <li>byte array.
425    *    </ul>
426    * @return The input converted to a string.
427    * @throws IOException If thrown from output stream.
428    */
429   public static String read(Object in) throws IOException {
430      if (in == null)
431         return null;
432      if (in instanceof Reader in2)
433         return read(in2);
434      if (in instanceof InputStream in2)
435         return read(in2);
436      if (in instanceof File in2)
437         return read(in2);
438      if (in instanceof byte[] in2)
439         return read(in2);
440      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid type passed to read:  " + in.getClass().getName());
441   }
442
443   /**
444    * Reads the specified byte array containing UTF-8 into a string.
445    *
446    * @param in
447    *    The input.
448    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
449    * @return The new string, or <jk>null</jk> if the input was null.
450    */
451   public static String read(byte[] in) {
452      return read(in, UTF8);
453   }
454
455   /**
456    * Reads the specified byte array into a string.
457    *
458    * @param in
459    *    The input.
460    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
461    * @param charset The character set to use for decoding.
462    * @return The new string, or <jk>null</jk> if the input was null.
463    */
464   public static String read(byte[] in, Charset charset) {
465      if (in == null)
466         return null;
467      return new String(in, charset);
468   }
469
470   /**
471    * Reads the contents of a file into a string.
472    *
473    * <p>
474    * Assumes default character encoding.
475    *
476    * @param in
477    *  The file to read.
478    *  <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
479    * @return
480    *  The contents of the reader as a string, or <jk>null</jk> if file does not exist.
481    * @throws IOException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
482    */
483   public static String read(File in) throws IOException {
484      if (in == null || ! in.exists())
485         return null;
486      try (var r = FileReaderBuilder.create(in).build()) {
487         return read(r, in.length());
488      }
489   }
490
491   /**
492    * Reads the contents of a path into a string.
493    *
494    * <p>
495    * Assumes default character encoding.
496    *
497    * @param in
498    *  The path to read.
499    *  <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
500    * @return
501    *  The contents of the reader as a string, or <jk>null</jk> if path does not exist.
502    * @throws IOException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
503    * @since 9.1.0
504    */
505   public static String read(Path in) throws IOException {
506      if (in == null || !Files.exists(in)) {
507         return null;
508      }
509      try (var r = PathReaderBuilder.create(in).build()) {
510         return read(r, Files.size(in));
511      }
512   }
513
514   /**
515    * Reads the contents of a reader into a string.
516    *
517    * @param in
518    *    The input reader.
519    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
520    *    <br>Stream is automatically closed.
521    * @return
522    *    The contents of the reader as a string, or <jk>null</jk> if the reader was <jk>null</jk>.
523    * @throws IOException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
524    */
525   public static String read(Reader in) throws IOException {
526      try (var in2 = in) {
527         return read(in, -1);
528      }
529   }
530
531   /**
532    * Reads the contents of a reader into a string.
533    *
534    * @param in
535    *    The input reader.
536    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
537    *    <br>Stream is automatically closed.
538    * @param onException Consumer of any {@link IOException I/O exceptions}.
539    * @return
540    *    The contents of the reader as a string, or <jk>null</jk> if the reader was <jk>null</jk>.
541    */
542   public static String read(Reader in, Consumer<IOException> onException) {
543      try (var in2 = in) {
544         return read(in, -1);
545      } catch (IOException e) {
546         onException.accept(e);
547         return null;
548      }
549   }
550
551   /**
552    * Reads the specified input into a {@link String} until the end of the input is reached.
553    *
554    * @param in
555    *    The input reader.
556    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
557    *    <br>String is automatically closed.
558    * @param expectedLength
559    *    Specify a positive number if the length of the input is known, or <c>-1</c> if unknown.
560    * @return
561    *    The contents of the reader as a string, or <jk>null</jk> if the reader was <jk>null</jk>.
562    * @throws IOException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
563    */
564   public static String read(Reader in, long expectedLength) throws IOException {
565      if (in == null)
566         return null;
567      try (var in2 = in) {
568         var sb = new StringBuilder(buffSize(expectedLength)); // Assume they're ASCII characters.
569         var buf = charBuffer((int)expectedLength);
570         var i = 0;
571         while ((i = in2.read(buf)) != -1)
572            sb.append(buf, 0, i);
573         return sb.toString();
574      }
575   }
576
577   /**
578    * Reads the contents of an input stream into a string.
579    *
580    * <p>
581    * Assumes UTF-8 encoding.
582    *
583    * @param in
584    *    The input stream.
585    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
586    *    <br>Stream is automatically closed.
587    * @return
588    *    The contents of the reader as a string, or <jk>null</jk> if the input stream was <jk>null</jk>.
589    * @throws IOException If a problem occurred trying to read from the input stream.
590    */
591   public static String read(InputStream in) throws IOException {
592      return read(in, UTF8);
593   }
594
595   /**
596    * Reads the contents of an input stream into a string.
597    *
598    * <p>
599    * Assumes UTF-8 encoding.
600    *
601    * @param in
602    *    The input stream.
603    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
604    *    <br>Stream is automatically closed.
605    * @param onException Consumer of any {@link IOException I/O exceptions}.
606    * @return
607    *    The contents of the reader as a string, or <jk>null</jk> if the input stream was <jk>null</jk>.
608    */
609   public static String read(InputStream in, Consumer<IOException> onException) {
610      return read(in, UTF8, onException);
611   }
612
613   /**
614    * Reads the contents of an input stream into a string using the specified charset.
615    *
616    * @param in
617    *    The input stream.
618    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
619    *    <br>Stream is automatically closed.
620    * @param cs
621    *    The charset of the contents of the input stream.
622    * @return
623    *    The contents of the reader as a string or <jk>null</jk> if input stream was <jk>null</jk>.
624    * @throws IOException If a problem occurred trying to read from the input stream.
625    */
626   public static String read(InputStream in, Charset cs) throws IOException {
627      if (in == null)
628         return null;
629      try (var isr = new InputStreamReader(in, cs)) {
630         return read(isr);
631      }
632   }
633
634   /**
635    * Reads the contents of an input stream into a string using the specified charset.
636    *
637    * @param in
638    *    The input stream.
639    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
640    *    <br>Stream is automatically closed.
641    * @param cs
642    *    The charset of the contents of the input stream.
643    * @param onException Consumer of any {@link IOException I/O exceptions}.
644    * @return
645    *    The contents of the reader as a string or <jk>null</jk> if input stream was <jk>null</jk>.
646    */
647   public static String read(InputStream in, Charset cs, Consumer<IOException> onException) {
648      if (in == null)
649         return null;
650      try (var isr = new InputStreamReader(in, cs)) {
651         return read(isr);
652      } catch (IOException e) {
653         onException.accept(e);
654         return null;
655      }
656   }
657
658   /**
659    * Reads the specified input stream into the specified byte array.
660    *
661    * @param in
662    *    The input stream to read.
663    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
664    *    <br>Stream is automatically closed.
665    * @return A byte array containing the contents.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
666    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
667    */
668   public static byte[] readBytes(InputStream in) throws IOException {
669      try (var in2 = in) {
670         return readBytes(in2, -1);
671      }
672   }
673
674   /**
675    * Reads the specified input stream into the specified byte array.
676    *
677    * @param in
678    *    The input stream to read.
679    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
680    *    <br>Stream is not automatically closed.
681    * @param maxBytes
682    *    The maximum number of bytes or <c>-1</c> to read the entire stream.
683    * @return A byte array containing the contents.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
684    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
685    */
686   public static byte[] readBytes(InputStream in, int maxBytes) throws IOException {
687      if (in == null)
688         return new byte[0];
689      var buff = new ByteArrayOutputStream(buffSize(maxBytes));
690      var nRead = 0;
691      var b = byteBuffer(maxBytes);
692      while ((nRead = in.read(b, 0, b.length)) != -1)
693         buff.write(b, 0, nRead);
694      buff.flush();
695      return buff.toByteArray();
696   }
697
698   /**
699    * Read the specified file into a byte array.
700    *
701    * @param in
702    *    The file to read into a byte array.
703    * @return The contents of the file as a byte array.
704    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
705    */
706   public static byte[] readBytes(File in) throws IOException {
707      return readBytes(in, -1);
708   }
709
710   /**
711    * Read the specified file into a byte array.
712    *
713    * @param in
714    *    The file to read into a byte array.
715    * @param maxBytes
716    *    The maximum number of bytes to read, or <jk>-1</jk> to read all bytes.
717    * @return The contents of the file as a byte array.
718    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
719    */
720   public static byte[] readBytes(File in, int maxBytes) throws IOException {
721      if (in == null || ! (in.exists() && in.canRead()))
722         return new byte[0];
723      try (var is = new FileInputStream(in)) {
724         return readBytes(is, maxBytes);
725      }
726   }
727
728   /**
729    * Reads the specified input stream into the specified byte array.
730    *
731    * @param in
732    *    The input stream to read.
733    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
734    *    <br>Stream is automatically closed.
735    * @return A byte array containing the contents.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
736    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
737    */
738   public static byte[] readBytes(Reader in) throws IOException {
739      if (in == null)
740         return new byte[0];
741      try (var in2 = in) {
742         return read(in2, -1).getBytes();
743      }
744   }
745
746   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
747   // Other utilities.
748   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
749
750   /**
751    * Wraps the specified reader in a buffered reader.
752    *
753    * @param r The reader being wrapped.
754    * @return
755    *    The reader wrapped in a {@link BufferedReader}, or the original {@link Reader} if it's already a buffered
756    *    reader.
757    */
758   public static Reader toBufferedReader(Reader r) {
759      if (r == null || r instanceof BufferedReader || r instanceof StringReader)
760         return r;
761      return new BufferedReader(r);
762   }
763
764   /**
765    * Counts the number of bytes in the input stream and then closes the stream.
766    *
767    * @param is The input stream to read from.
768    * @return The number of bytes read.
769    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
770    */
771   public static long count(InputStream is) throws IOException {
772      if (is == null)
773         return 0;
774      var c = 0l;
775      var i = 0l;
776      try {
777         while ((i = is.skip(1024)) != 0)
778            c += i;
779      } finally {
780         is.close();
781      }
782      return c;
783   }
784
785   /**
786    * Counts the number of characters in the reader and then closes the reader.
787    *
788    * @param r The reader to read from.
789    * @return The number of characters read.
790    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
791    */
792   public static long count(Reader r) throws IOException {
793      if (r == null)
794         return 0;
795      var c = 0l;
796      var i = 0l;
797      try {
798         while ((i = r.skip(1024)) != 0)
799            c += i;
800      } finally {
801         r.close();
802      }
803      return c;
804   }
805
806   /**
807    * Close input stream and ignore any exceptions.
808    *
809    * <p>
810    * No-op if input stream is <jk>null</jk>.
811    *
812    * @param is The input stream to close.
813    */
814   public static void closeQuietly(InputStream is) {
815      try {
816         if (is != null)
817            is.close();
818      } catch (IOException e) { /* ignore */ }
819   }
820
821   /**
822    * Close output stream and ignore any exceptions.
823    *
824    * <p>
825    * No-op if output stream is <jk>null</jk>.
826    *
827    * @param os The output stream to close.
828    */
829   public static void closeQuietly(OutputStream os) {
830      try {
831         if (os != null)
832            os.close();
833      } catch (IOException e) { /* ignore */ }
834   }
835
836   /**
837    * Close reader and ignore any exceptions.
838    *
839    * <p>
840    * No-op if reader is <jk>null</jk>.
841    *
842    * @param r The reader to close.
843    */
844   public static void closeQuietly(Reader r) {
845      try {
846         if (r != null)
847            r.close();
848      } catch (IOException e) { /* ignore */ }
849   }
850
851   /**
852    * Close writer and ignore any exceptions.
853    *
854    * <p>
855    * No-op if writer is <jk>null</jk>.
856    *
857    * @param w The writer to close.
858    */
859   public static void closeQuietly(Writer w) {
860      try {
861         if (w != null)
862            w.close();
863      } catch (IOException e) { /* ignore */ }
864   }
865
866   /**
867    * Quietly close all specified input streams, output streams, readers, and writers.
868    *
869    * @param o The list of all objects to quietly close.
870    */
871   public static void closeQuietly(Object...o) {
872      for (var o2 : o) {
873         if (o2 instanceof InputStream o3)
874            closeQuietly(o3);
875         if (o2 instanceof OutputStream o3)
876            closeQuietly(o3);
877         if (o2 instanceof Reader o3)
878            closeQuietly(o3);
879         if (o2 instanceof Writer o3)
880            closeQuietly(o3);
881      }
882   }
883
884   /**
885    * Flushes multiple output streams and writers in a single call.
886    *
887    * @param o
888    *    The objects to flush.
889    *    <jk>null</jk> entries are ignored.
890    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
891    */
892   public static void flush(Object...o) throws IOException {
893      IOException ex = null;
894      for (var o2 : o) {
895         try {
896            if (o2 instanceof OutputStream o3)
897               o3.flush();
898            if (o2 instanceof Writer o3)
899               o3.flush();
900         } catch (IOException e) {
901            ex = e;
902         }
903      }
904      if (ex != null)
905         throw ex;
906   }
907
908   /**
909    * Close all specified input streams, output streams, readers, and writers.
910    *
911    * @param o
912    *    The list of all objects to close.
913    *    <jk>null</jk> entries are ignored.
914    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
915    */
916   public static void close(Object...o) throws IOException {
917      IOException ex = null;
918      for (var o2 : o) {
919         try {
920            if (o2 instanceof InputStream o3)
921               o3.close();
922            if (o2 instanceof OutputStream o3)
923               o3.close();
924            if (o2 instanceof Reader o3)
925               o3.close();
926            if (o2 instanceof Writer o3)
927               o3.close();
928         } catch (IOException e) {
929            ex = e;
930         }
931      }
932      if (ex != null)
933         throw ex;
934   }
935
936   /**
937    * Loads a text file from either the file system or classpath.
938    *
939    * @param name The file name.
940    * @param paths The paths to search.
941    * @return The file contents, or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
942    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
943    */
944   public static String loadSystemResourceAsString(String name, String...paths) throws IOException {
945      for (var path : paths) {
946         var p = new File(path);
947         if (p.exists()) {
948            var f = new File(p, name);
949            if (f.exists() && f.canRead())
950               return read(f);
951         }
952      }
953      var cl = Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader();
954      if (cl == null)
955         cl = ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader();
956      for (var path : paths) {
957         var n = ".".equals(path) ? name : path + '/' + name;
958         try (var is = cl.getResourceAsStream(n)) {
959            if (is != null)
960               return read(is);
961         }
962         try (var is = ClassLoader.getSystemResourceAsStream(n)) {
963            if (is != null)
964               return read(is);
965         }
966      }
967      return null;
968   }
969
970   private static byte[] byteBuffer(int maxBytes) {
971      if (BYTE_BUFFER_CACHE != null) {
972         var x = BYTE_BUFFER_CACHE.get();
973         if (x == null) {
974            x = new byte[BUFF_SIZE];
975            BYTE_BUFFER_CACHE.set(x);
976            BYTE_BUFFER_CACHE_MISSES.incrementAndGet();
977         } else {
978            BYTE_BUFFER_CACHE_HITS.incrementAndGet();
979         }
980         return x;
981      }
982      return new byte[buffSize(maxBytes)];
983   }
984
985   private static char[] charBuffer(int maxChars) {
986      if (CHAR_BUFFER_CACHE != null) {
987         var x = CHAR_BUFFER_CACHE.get();
988         if (x == null) {
989            x = new char[BUFF_SIZE];
990            CHAR_BUFFER_CACHE.set(x);
991            CHAR_BUFFER_CACHE_MISSES.incrementAndGet();
992         } else {
993            CHAR_BUFFER_CACHE_HITS.incrementAndGet();
994         }
995         return x;
996      }
997      return new char[buffSize(maxChars)];
998   }
999
1000   private static int buffSize(long max) {
1001      return (max > 0 && max < BUFF_SIZE) ? (int)max : BUFF_SIZE;
1002   }
1003}
